DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Chromogranin A Tumor Marker Result Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The date on which a laboratory test was performed for Chromogranin A (CHGA, Secretory Protein I, Parathyroid Secretory Protein, PSP), a protein that is stored and released with catecholamines in the adrenal medulla, as well as with PTH from the parathyroid gland, and is also secreted by many endocrine neoplasms: pheochromocytoma, parathyroid adenoma, medullary thyroid carcinoma, carcinoids, oat-cell lung cancer, pancreatic islet-cell tumors, and aortic-body tumor.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Chromogranin A Tumor Marker Result
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the result of the medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood or tissue for Chromogranin A (CHGA, Secretory Protein I, Parathyroid Secretory Protein, PSP),  a protein that is stored and released with catecholamines in the adrenal medulla, as well as with PTH from the parathyroid gland, and is also secreted by many endocrine neoplasms: pheochromocytoma, parathyroid adenoma, medullary thyroid carcinoma, carcinoids, oat-cell lung cancer, pancreatic islet-cell tumors, and aortic-body tumor.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: Chromogranin A (CHGA, Secretory Protein I, Parathyroid Secretory Protein, PSP) is stored and released with catecholamines in the adrenal medulla, as well as with PTH from the parathyroid gland.  CHGA is also secreted by many endocrine neoplasms: pheochromocytoma, parathyroid adenoma, medullary thyroid carcinoma, carcinoids, oat-cell lung cancer, pancreatic islet-cell tumors, and aortic-body tumor.  Its secretion is inversely proportional to extracellular calcium concentration, as is its degree of phosphorylation.  Its function is unknown.  Pancreastatin, derived from CHGA (pancreatic alpha cells), may be important for the homeostasis of blood insulin levels.  Chromostatin (pancreatic beta cells) is also a CHGA-derived bioactive peptide.  (from OMIM 118910 and NCI):A substance sometimes found in an increased amount in the blood, other body fluids, or tissues and which may mean that a certain type of cancer is in the body. Examples of tumor markers include CA 125 (ovarian cancer), CA 15-3 (breast cancer), CEA (ovarian, lung, breast, pancreas, and gastrointestinal tract cancers), and PSA (prostate cancer). Also called biomarker.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: Chromogranin-A (457 aa, ~51 kDa) is encoded by the human CHGA gene. This protein plays a role in the modulation of both blood pressure and pancreatic release of insulin.

A substance present in or produced by a tumor or by the host, that can be used for differentiating neoplastic from normal tissue based on measurements in body fluids, secretions, cells, and/or tissues. Markers are used in diagnosis, staging and prognosis of cancer, provide an estimation of tumor burden, and serve for monitoring effects of therapy, detecting recurrence, localization of tumors, and screening in general populations.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.
